fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33588].
  {panel}

In salesforce development custom fields are followed by {{__c}}.  Because the inline unformatted does not escape the {{__}} correctly it causes weird formatting.  Like italicizing text in between fields.  

Example:

*Add {{my_field__c}}, {{my_field2__c}} and {{my_field3__c}} to deployment package
*Change {{my_field__c}} to text type

related to CONF-8268
fields.summary: Inline unformatted does not escape __

Welcome, looks like you’re new here

This currently gives a 404 error.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33585].
  {panel}

Currently, only System Administrator and Confluence Administrator have the rights to Edit Confluence Dashboard.

A great improvement to the dashboard feature would be the ability to set permissions (similar to Confluence space permissions) to allow other specific users edit/change the dashboard. 

Example :
Confluence Administrator can grant one or two user the permission to edit the Dashboard.
fields.summary: Set of Permission to Edit Confluence Dashboard

fields.description:
Unit/wired/integration tests do not seem to appear in the Atlassian Plugin Test Console in Confluence 5.5.0, while the same plugin works in Confluence 5.4.4.

Steps I can use to reproduce with Atlassian SDK 4.2.20:
1) Create a new plug-in with atlas-create-confluence-plugin. Make up some groupId (e.g. "com.example"), make up some artifactId (e.g. "test55"), then leave the rest default.
2) Run the plug-in with atlas-debug.
3) When started, go to the APTC url, mine is at: http://127.0.0.1:1990/confluence/plugins/servlet/it-test-console
4) There are no tests, the unit and integration tests for MyPluginComponent are missing!

Additional steps:
5) Change the values for confluence.version and confluence.data.version in the pom.xml to 5.4.4 instead of 5.5.0.
6) Clean and restart with atlas-mvn clean && atlas-debug
7) Access the APCT.
8) There are now two tests for MyPluginComponent, which is correct.
 
I have attached the logs that are created when starting Confluence and then accessing the APCT. There seems to be some exceptions related to AbstractStringTransformedDownloadableResource.

Best regards
Nicho
fields.summary: Tests do not appear in Atlassian Plugin Test Console in 5.5

fields.description:
This documentation is incorrect: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Installation+Directory

There are several directories in the install folder which are constantly written to, including the temp, work, and logs directories.

The current documentation is confusing some customers, as they expect to be able to have the directory be read-only based on the sentence, "Confluence does not modify or store any data in this directory."
fields.summary: Confluence Installation Directory documentation incorrect

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h4.Steps to Reproduce:
# Create a *Page*.
# Insert a *Chart Macro*.
# Inserted a *Office Excel macro* or *JIRA Macro* into *Chart Macro*.
# Try to edit *Chart Macro*
  
h4.Expected Results:
 It must show the chart with JIRA Macro or Excel file content
h4.Actual Results:
Following error appears in the preview page:{code} Error rendering macro 'chart' : org.dom4j.DocumentException: Error on line 1 of document : The element type "img" must be terminated by the matching end-tag "</img>". Nested exception: The element type "img" must be terminated by the matching end-tag "</img>". {code}

fields.description:
Two issues:
1) Importing a Single Space does not add Indexed pages in Shortcuts
2) After adding the indexed pages manually, they do not show the correct icon. Instead they all show the Decision icon.

Steps to reproduce:
I exported a single space from 5.4.4 in XML format using Full Export option. 
I imported the Space using restore and backup.
After the import, I was able to view my imported space, however, the Index pages did not appear in the Sidebar as Shortcuts like they did before.
When I used the Configure Sidebar to Add the index pages as Shortcut Links, the Troubleshooting icon did not appear as it did prior to the export, nor did the How-To-Articles, Shared Links, etc.
I noticed that when I edited the index pages and edit/Create from Template Macro I noticed that all had "Template Name*" at "Decision" instead of the corresponding Template.
fields.summary: Importing a Single Space does not add Indexed pages in Shortcuts
Prevent Space Admins from deleting Confluence Admins

fields.description: If there is any formatting applied to the headings of the table in a page properties macro, the page properties report macro will see it as a different heading. For example, if on one page a heading is {{key1}} and on another page the heading is {{key1}} the report macro sees two headings. This is most pronounced when the 'Columns to show' is populated in the 'Page properties report' Macro. It is case sensitive as well. I think this macro would function best if tags were stripped when parsing the headings.
fields.summary: Page Properties Report chokes on formatted headings
Unmigrated Wiki Content Checker to List Affected Pages and Related Plugins

fields.description:
The error:
==> app/confluence/test/run/logs/catalina.out <==
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/juli/logging/LogFactory
	at org.apache.catalina.startup.Bootstrap.<clinit>(Bootstrap.java:60)
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.apache.juli.logging.LogFactory
	at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
	at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
	at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)

we're still in our testing period, but since v5.5 came out, we skipped the 5.4.4 upgrade to move directly to the 5.5 release.
Our upgrade is fully automated, which doesn't give any issue on installing v5.4.4 and any former release, but I keep getting this error.

I already found that this error is generated because of a faulty zip-file, but after redownloading it 3x it still doesn't change a thing.
fields.summary: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError after upgrade to v5.5

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33573].
  {panel}

When using a screen reader to interpret Confluence (in this example, the screen reader used was JAWS screen reader), there are a number of problems :

* The first item on the page (a logo?) has not be labelled, it just says “graphic”
* The link between “Help” and the user’s name has been labelled “0”
* The item that follows immediately after the user’s name (a logo again?) is unlabelled and just says “graphic”
* It impossible to upload files as the ‘browse for files’ option does not appear to be visible to a screenreader or accessible using the keyboard

These should be rectified to make Confluence more accessible to visually-impaired users
fields.summary: Improve the accessibility of Confluence when using a screen reader
Select columns or rows in a table to apply formatting
"View Changes" link in "Changes in the last 24 hours" emails should show all changes in the 24 hour period not just the most recent.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33566].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Page properties report macro is not sorting DD/MM/YYYY in the proper order; that is, going by month year first, then month, then day. Instead, it is sorting in alpha-numeric order.

!date_sort.png!

h3. Environment
* Confluence
* Page Properties Macros 4.3.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a few pages with a table including a date in one column with typing {{//}}
# Add a common label to those pages.
# Create a new page with Page Properties Report Macro and include the date column


h3. Expected Results
- With date format MM/DD/YYYY attempt to sort; should sort in logical order.

h3. Actual Results
- In some cases, will sort alpha-numeric order instead.
- In the original example, it was the simple DD MMM YYYY, however, I have also seen the issue only when switching browser language to German and allowing confluence to switch to German
fields.summary: Page properties report doesn't sort by date properly
Task report macro: Make columns sortable
Task report macro: Include space name in location column

Hi,

fields.summary: Copy/Paste picture with Firefox 29

fields.description:
In production environments configuration are changing, and it is really easy to end-up with cases like:

* the server name has changed - that's the App Title of jira
* URL of of the target JIRA can change, domain do change!
* serverID of can change, for example when two instances are merged or split.
* jira macro code can be missing the serverid (yes only servername) -- observed it quite often.

If any 2 of the above are happening at the same time, you are ending up with lots of broken JIRA macros, ones that you cannot solve using KB article https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=590251843

In order to fix this for good JIRA needs few patches:
* Auto repair URL redirected AppLinks - a 301 response on an AppLink should auto-reconfigure the app link. HTTP 301 is a permanent redirect, not a temporary one.
* When encountering a jira link that is using an AppLink that is redirected, fixit. If possible this should be part of self-repair scheduled task.
* When encountering a jira-macro without server-id, add the server id to it
* When unable to repair AppLinks from JIRA Macro include the servername and serverid in the error message displayed on the UI.
* Allow people to have aliases for servernames, that's the only way to fix previous point without having to do search and replace at database level.
fields.summary: Confluence JIRA macros are broken and AppLinks changes cannot not fix them

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a new page
2. Insert some headings and apply additional formatting to those headings (e.g. make some bold, underlined, add a icon or small image.) - the formatting won't appear on the headings (this used to work before)
3. Insert a table of contents

this made the TOC very useful.
Please re enable this with a options in the TOC to keep the current format.
fields.summary: Table of contents (TOC) does not display formatting of headings it includes (undo the fix, redo as a option)

fields.description:
On seemingly every click, Confluence throws a warning similar to the following:

{code}
2014-05-05 17:40:45,417 WARN [http-bio-8055-exec-10] [atlassian.confluence.cache.TransactionalCacheFactory] warning Transactional cache update outside transaction. All updates to this cache should be performed from a thread with a valid transaction context.
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install and start Confluence 5.5
# Click around and monitor the logs

h3. Workaround
To suppress the warnings, edit <confluence-install-directory>/confluence/WEB-INF/classes/log4j.properties:

{code}
...
## caching debugging
log4j.logger.com.atlassian.confluence.cache=ERROR, confluencelog
log4j.additivity.com.atlassian.confluence.cache=false
{code}
fields.summary: Transactions cache warnings thrown continuously

fields.description:
When attempting an upgrade to 5.5 the logs will show the following:

{code}2014-05-02 12:28:46,220 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [com.atlassian.confluence.lifecycle] contextInitialized Starting Confluence 5.5 [build 5501 based on commit hash a39771cd4bb7ab00a226a7ea8d6dd65e64226a7f]
2014-05-02 12:28:48,451 WARN [localhost-startStop-1] [atlassian.config.xml.AbstractDom4jXmlConfigurationPersister] saveDocumentAtomically Unable to move C:\Program Files\Atlassian\Application Data\Confluence\confluence.cfg.xml1232542810330726807tmp to C:\Program Files\Atlassian\Application Data\Confluence\confluence.cfg.xml. Falling back to non-atomic overwrite.
2014-05-02 12:28:48,482 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [springframework.web.context.ContextLoader] initWebApplicationContext Root WebApplicationContext: initialization started
2014-05-02 12:28:51,711 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [com.atlassian.confluence.lifecycle] <init> Loading EhCache cache manager
2014-05-02 12:29:01,524 WARN [localhost-startStop-1] [org.springframework.beans.TypeConverterDelegate] findDefaultEditor PropertyEditor [com.sun.beans.editors.EnumEditor] found through deprecated global PropertyEditorManager fallback - consider using a more isolated form of registration, e.g. on the BeanWrapper/BeanFactory!
2014-05-02 12:29:08,575 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [springframework.web.context.ContextLoader] initWebApplicationContext Root WebApplicationContext: initialization completed in 20093 ms
2014-05-02 12:29:08,668 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [confluence.upgrade.impl.DefaultUpgradeManager] beforeUpgrade Generating pre-upgrade recovery file...
2014-05-02 12:29:08,699 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [confluence.upgrade.recovery.ConfluenceProgressMonitor] begin []
2014-05-02 12:29:08,699 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [confluence.upgrade.recovery.ConfluenceProgressMonitor] begin DATABASE_INFORMATION: []
2014-05-02 12:29:08,715 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [confluence.upgrade.recovery.ConfluenceProgressMonitor] end DATABASE_INFORMATION: []
...
...
...
 2014-05-02 12:29:10,961 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [confluence.upgrade.recovery.ConfluenceProgressMonitor] end TABLE_DATA: [os_user_group]
2014-05-02 12:29:10,961 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [confluence.upgrade.recovery.ConfluenceProgressMonitor] begin TABLE_DATA: [pagetemplates]
2014-05-02 12:29:10,961 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [confluence.upgrade.recovery.ConfluenceProgressMonitor] end TABLE_DATA: [pagetemplates]

2014-05-02 12:35:55,099 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [com.atlassian.confluence.lifecycle] contextInitialized Starting Confluence 5.5 [build 5501 based on commit hash a39771cd4bb7ab00a226a7ea8d6dd65e64226a7f]   {code}

The catalina logs from this time show:

{code}SEVERE: A child container failed during start
java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
...
Caused by: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
...
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.node.stax.StaxStreamWriter$1.setContentAsBinary(StaxStreamWriter.java:131)
...
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.DbExporter.exportData(DbExporter.java:53)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.recovery.DefaultRecoveryFileGenerator.generate(DefaultRecoveryFileGenerator.java:76)

The pre-upgrade recovery file should be writing straight to disk, so shouldn't be susceptible of OOMEs at all. 

*Steps to Replicate:*
# Install Confluence 5.4.4 (or any version prior to 5.5)
# Install a number of add-ons, particularly large add-ons such a Gliffy
# Attempt the upgrade 

*Workaround:*

Please refer to [Upgrade to 5.5 hangs when generating pre-upgrade recovery file|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Upgrade+to+5.5+hangs+when+generating+pre-upgrade+recovery+file].

fields.description:
I am currently working on a Confluence plugin that uses a ContentEntityObject subclass (= a UserStatus) and I ran into an issue.

The user can like this ContentEntityObject, and it works when the user is trying to like his or her own content. Problem is, when the content is not his/her own, we get a RuntimeException:

{noformat}
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] java.lang.RuntimeException: com.atlassian.confluence.userstatus.UserStatus cannot be cast to com.atlassian.confluence.pages.AbstractPage
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.event.internal.SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.invoke(SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.java:54)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.event.internal.AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher$2.run(AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher.java:66)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.event.internal.AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher$1.execute(AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher.java:32)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.event.internal.AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher.dispatch(AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher.java:60)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.event.internal.EventPublisherImpl.invokeListeners(EventPublisherImpl.java:160)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.event.internal.EventPublisherImpl.publish(EventPublisherImpl.java:79)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.confluence.like.DefaultLikeManager.addLike(DefaultLikeManager.java:88)
{noformat}

That's because of the LikeEvent that is dispatched after the LikeEntity has been created, it seems there is a listener that expects an "AbstractPage" object with this event, which our object is not (here it's an UserStatus).

It doesn't seem very logical to me to be able to like any ContentEntityObject but crash if you try to like something that is not a BlogPost or a Page.
fields.summary: Unable to like a ContentEntityObject that is not an AbstractPage

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33550].
  {panel}


It seems that the links to confluence attachments are not permalinks (stabe links). 

Example:

https://example.com/download/attachments/116065791/file.pdf?version=1&modificationDate=1361208962871&api=v2

Instead they should be like

https://example.com/download/attachments/116065791/file.pdf

And obviously, uploading a new version of an attachment should not change its permalink.

That's an essential feature for any HTML application. By not conforming with this Confluence is breaking HTTP standards and making indexing and search much harder.

Also, the same design flaw does break lots of links from other web applications (when the attachment is updated).
fields.summary: provide permalinks to confluence attachments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33548].
  {panel}

h6. Overview 
This was originally raised as a bug in [CONF-32989|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-32989]. After reviewing the issue, it can be considered an *Improvement* to have the following in the *JIRA Issue Macro*:
* _Assignee_ and _Reporter_ system fields should have a hyperlink to the user's profile
* Other custom fields that utilizes users should also have this functionality
* When you have a multi user picker listed as one of the columns, there should be a separator between names i.e coma, hyphen, etc.

This will make the JIRA Issue Macro more re-presentable and easier to check if there are more than one user(s) listed in the column.

h6. Screen shot
!default_view.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Username & profile rendering in JIRA Issue Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33547].
  {panel}

Thanks to [~sday@atlassian.com]

We could see that the email doesn't show the number of lines / last line matched in the report. This is actually why there's a discrepancy.

Going further on this, we actually have a bunch of regex patterns in Sisyphus that match the same thing. e.g:

CONF-13900 vs CONFKB394463234
CONF-29000 vs CONFKB355369050
CONFKB151519398 vs CONFKB331914082
CONFKB217743871 vs CONFKB223217565
CONFKB282169412 vs CONFKB282173819

The manual scan puts all matches into a TreeSet, which will eliminate duplicates based on the ordering algorithm. The problem is because a few issues match the exact same line, and we sort based on the last line matched, only one match result "wins out", the other is considered a duplicate (even though it's a different match).

I think the best way to address this would actually be to make the email report consistent with the manual scan, in that the number of lines + last matching line are shown. This will actually mean that for this particular customers case, the scheduled email will start reporting less matches than before. Ideally we should also be looking at some of the regex collisions above and fixing those too.
fields.summary: Improve regex patterns when using Hercules X Scheduled Scan

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33546].
  {panel}

It's quite hard to convince the users to leave a comment in the 'What did you change?' field after they have modified a page. They just ignore the field. Since 'Notify watchers' is switched on by default, the watchers get notification mails but they cannot see what the change was about. To find out, they have to click the link and check. Quite often it was a small change and not important for them, so this proves wasted time.

We would like configuration options in Confluence administration:
* 'What did you change?' required field yes / no
* 'Notify watchers' default on / off
fields.summary: Add configuration option for 'What did you change?' or 'Notify watchers'

fields.description:
h3. Symptom

"Created vs Resolved" JIRA Chart macro cannot be inserted with the following condition:
- when using Chinese or Japanese (maybe other non-English languages also)
- when Confluence is running on Windows

h3. Steps to reproduce

This is how I reproduced:
# Prepare vanilla Windows 7 Pro
# Change the System Locale to Japanese (and restart the OS as required)
# Install Confluence 5.8.4 and JIRA 6.4.7, and create an Application Link between them
# On JIRA, Create some issues, and change the language to Japanese
# On Confluence, click "Create" button and try to insert "Created vs Resolved" JIRA Chart macro (but end in failure)

h3. Original description by the customer

Insert the other macros in the confluence text, encounter problems using the JIRA chart.
Search to the data, selecting managers or priority, error, tips
Because the execution error, can not show the macro JIRA chart

I found the following clues in the log:
{noformat}
2014-05-05 11:10:26693 ERROR [http-8090-101] [confluence.plugins.jira.ChartProxyServlet] getRedirectImgLink Unable to parse JIRA chart macro JSON to object
- url: /plugins/servlet/jira-chart-proxy userName: lie |
Com.google.gson.JsonSyntaxException: com.google.gson.stream.MalformedJsonException: Unterminated object near " statType" ": Á - è ä û ‰ ∫?, " imageMap&quot: " <map; id=\"
{noformat}
Seems to be Chinese garbled caused by Json could not be resolved, may be required to submit a Atlassian to look at.

PS：I use the Chinese language，JIRA creates no problem。
fields.summary: Cannot insert "Created vs Resolved" JIRA Chart macro

fields.description:
This is one of several hard-to-pinpoint failures to handle codes correctly when converting (saving Confluence pages).  I'll post them as I track them down.  

This current issue breaks the use case of copying content from blogs.  Copying content to the clipboard and then pasting into Confluence causes this failure when the source is an HTML document which contains Time Datetime where both date and time are specified.  Just date saves fine.  

Here is an example blog post: http://circuitcellar.com/ee-tips/triangulation-trilateration-or-multilateration-ee-tip-125/

Attached is a test page.
fields.summary: Error "Failure when converting editor format to storage format" when pasted content contains time datetime where date is appended by time, as found when copying blog posts.

fields.description:
When pasting wiki markup into the page editor pane the editor fails to recognize and convert the markup. For example, here is the markup for a simple 3 line table: {code} || Heading 1 || Heading 2 || | Left 1 | Right 1 | | Left 2 | Right 2 | {code} After pasting this block appears in the html as {code}

|| Heading 1 || Heading 2 ||
| Left 1 | Right 1 |
| Left 2 | Right 2 |

{code} I expected instead to get a real table: || Heading 1 || Heading 2 || | Left 1 | Right 1 | | Left 2 | Right 2 | Note that pasting wiki markup *in this JIRA form* does the right thing. Pasting into a Confluence edit pane does not.
fields.summary: Pasting wiki markup into editor pane fails to convert

fields.description:
*Environment*
* Windows 7 - Build 760, SP 1
* Chrome: 34.0.1847.131 m
* IE: 11.0.9600.17041

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Create a new Confluence page in Chrome.
# Add some content to this page such that it requires some scrolling to reach the bottom of the content.
# At the top of the page, press Ctrl + Shift + I to invoke the new table dialog. Create a table that has a heading row and at least one body row.
# Using the mouse, click into the first cell of the first body row of the new table.
# Press Ctrl + Right Arrow.

*Expected Result*
* If Ctrl + Right arrow is pressed while in a column for which a column to the right exists on the current row, move to the next column.
* If Ctrl + Right arrow is pressed while in the last column of the row and a row exists below the current row, move to the first cell of the next row.
* If Ctrl + Right arrow is pressed while in the last column of the row and a row does not exist below the current row, move to the beginning of the document content line immediately following the table.

Short version of expected result: Should behave like it does in IE.

*Actual Result*
The scroll position changes to and the the cursor is positioned at the end of the document.
fields.summary: Chrome - Table Editor - Pressing Ctrl + Right Arrow in table cell moves to the end of the document

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33527].
  {panel}

UPDATE: note I entered this in the wrong place, this is a bug in JIRA not in Confluence. This issue can be deleted, I've re-entered it as JIRA-38127.

------

The "Edit Name" functionality on an Epic in the Agile Planning View is essentially broken.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create an Epic with a reasonable story name - maybe around 7-8 words, 40-50 characters
2. Switch to the Agile Planning view which shows the Versions/Epics/Issues columns.
3. Find your epic, click on the drop-down menu indicator and select "Edit Name"
4. Type in a new name about the same length as the old name.

Result: the edit field prevents you from typing in more than 30 characters
Expected: the edit field doesn't have any stricter limitations than if you were editing the name directly in the Epic's editor view

(continuing)
5. Go ahead an accept the new, shortened name in this Edit Name text field
6. Now open the Epic in its full editor view
Result: the new name assigned to the epic is apparently only a special alias for that planning view, not actually the new name of the epic. In fact if you toggle open the disclosure in the planning view you can see the epic now has two names - the long original name, and the constrained name that was just introduced by this (bogus?) "Edit Name" command
Expected: if we're chaining the name of the epic, it should change the name of the epic, not introduce some new bizarre alias only visible in the planning GUI

(continuing)
8. Get rid of the bogus short name that the Planning view "Edit Name" command has introduced
Expected: there's an obvious way to do this
Actual: there's no obvious way to do this

Thanks for fixing!
fields.summary: Planning view Epic "Edit Name" functionality is limited, broken, irreversible

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33522].
  {panel}

One common total crash for Confluence is when it does run out of database connection. 

Any reliable web application should be able to resist to a peak in number of request and not to fully crash when this happens. 

This is also a security issue because it means that anyone could easily bring the server down just by issuing requests to it.

The correct behavior is to stop processing new requests when this happens and to respond with HTTP 503, also logging an ERROR.
fields.summary: prevent crashing when running out of database connections

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33521].
  {panel}

*Background of The Request*

At the moment there are no ways for user or administrators to export or save a space into a template that could be use in the future by other users when they create a new space or pages. 

For example :
A company would like to have their own space template with links in the sidebar and the body of the page prefigured with some panels in the space. 
For now they only can create a blank space or copy an existing one, then create the pages that appear in the sidebar. 
It will ease them if they can just generate it instead of creating a blank space or copy an existing one.
fields.summary: Save Space as template

fields.description:
We have fixed a vulnerability in our version of an Xwork library which is also part of Apache Struts. Attackers can use this vulnerability to execute Java code of their choice on systems that use these frameworks. The attacker needs to be able to access the Confluence web interface. In cases when anonymous access is enabled, a valid user account is not required to exploit this vulnerability.

We have discovered this vulnerability during our review of the recent Struts security advisories. This vulnerability is specific to Confluence.
The vulnerability affects all versions of Confluence up to and including 5.5.1.

For more information see the full [advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Security+Advisory+2014-05-21].
fields.summary: ClassLoader Manipulation vulnerability

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce 
# Setup a Confluence instance to point to a MySQL Database
# Set the {{hibernate.c3p0.min_size}} property in {{confluence.cfg.xml}} to a non-zero value. 
# Monitor the number of connections created to the MySQL database over the next couple minutes with:
{code}select user, count(*) from information_schema.processlist group by user;{code}

h5. Expected Results
The database connections should stay between the bounds of min_size and max_size.

h5. Actual Results 
The database connections surpass the bound set in max_size, and end up being up to 7 times the number set in min_size.

h5. Workaround
Setting the min_size value to 0 will lead to the max_size being obeyed.

Alternatively, if strict control of the number of connections is required, divide your intended connection pool size by 7 and set your min_size to this value.
fields.summary: Setting hibernate.c3p0.min_size causes Confluence to use up to 7 times the specified connections, regardless of max_size on MySQL

fields.description:
Probably the CONTENT's column 'VERSION' is referenced as 'version' in task migration upgrade task:

{noformat}
2014-05-01 18:27:27,196 INFO [StorageToAoMigrationUpgradeTask-PageFinder] [plugins.tasklist.upgradetask.StorageToAoMigrationPageFinder] run Starting migration of tasks in 8208 pages to Active Objects.
2014-05-01 18:27:36,768 ERROR [StorageToAoMigrationUpgradeTask-TaskExtractor-1] [sf.hibernate.util.JDBCExceptionReporter] logExceptions Invalid column name 'version'.
2014-05-01 18:27:36,770 ERROR [StorageToAoMigrationUpgradeTask-TaskExtractor-1] [sf.hibernate.util.JDBCExceptionReporter] logExceptions Invalid column name 'version'.
2014-05-01 18:27:36,775 ERROR [StorageToAoMigrationUpgradeTask-TaskExtractor-1] [plugins.tasklist.upgradetask.InterruptingUncaughtExceptionHandler] uncaughtException Uncaught exception in thread StorageToAoMigrationUpgradeTask-TaskExtractor-1. Interrupting all threads.
org.springframework.jdbc.BadSqlGrammarException: Hibernate operation: Could not execute query; bad SQL grammar []; nested exception is java.sql.SQLException: Invalid column name 'version'.
{noformat}
fields.summary: Upgrade Task fails on a case-sensitive SQL Server for 5.5

fields.description:
{panel}
We have published new installers for Windows 32 and 64-bit on www.atlassian.com that fix this issue. Thank you for your patience.
\\
* [Windows 32-bit|http://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/downloads/binary/atlassian-confluence-5.5-1-x32.exe]
* [Windows 64-bit|http://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/downloads/binary/atlassian-confluence-5.5-1-x64.exe]
{panel}
h5.Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence 5.4.4 or below; ensuring you install as a service
# Run through the installation process, ensure you can log into Confluence
# Run the 5.5 installer, selecting to upgrade your 5.4.4 instance

h5.Expected Results
* Confluence should start after the installer completes.

h5.Actual Results
* Confluence does not start after the installer completes.
* Confluence is not running via {{services.msc}}
* Attempting to start Confluence results in the following error:

{noformat}
Windows could not start the Atlassian Confluence service on Local Computer.

Error 2: The system cannot find the file specified.
{noformat}

h5. Solution
If *you have not yet used the problematic 5.5 installer*, you can use these new installers:
* [Windows 32-bit|http://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/downloads/binary/atlassian-confluence-5.5-1-x32.exe]
* [Windows 64-bit|http://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/downloads/binary/atlassian-confluence-5.5-1-x64.exe]

If *you have already used the problematic 5.5 installer*, you will have to apply the workaround.

h5.Workaround
(!) Incorrectly modifying the Windows Registry could leave your Windows computer inoperable - always ensure that you have a backup of your registry before making any changes.

# Start -> Run -> Type "regedit.exe" and click OK
# Browse to {{HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\services\}} and look for the key that starts with "Confluence"
#* _In one instance, the key was labelled as Confluence01051465235_
# Double click the "ImagePath" value
# In the text box, replace {{tomcat6.exe}} with {{tomcat7.exe}}. For example:

{code}
"C:\Program Files\Atlassian\Confluence\bin\tomcat6.exe" //RS//Confluence010514165235
{code}

becomes 

{code}"C:\Program Files\Atlassian\Confluence\bin\tomcat7.exe" //RS//Confluence010514165235{code}

Attempt to restart Confluence via {{services.msc}} - it should start up correctly. Note that you may need to refresh the Services snap-in so that it picks up the new value from the registry.
fields.summary: After upgrading to Confluence 5.5 on Windows, the service will not start

fields.description:
After user add a *Confluence: News* gadget URL to the gadget directory in JIRA, we get the following stack trace:
{noformat}
013-10-09 15:48:01,685 http-bio-8080-exec-22 ERROR admin 947x685x1 xa23yq 10.60.2.145 /rest/config/1.0/directory [directory.internal.rest.DirectoryResource] DirectoryResource: POST rejected: could not parse gadget at http://10.60.2.116:8090/conf/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.gadgets:gadget-search/gadgets/gadget-search.xml
com.atlassian.gadgets.GadgetParsingException: com.atlassian.gadgets.GadgetParsingException: org.apache.shindig.gadgets.GadgetException: Unable to retrieve gadget xml. HTTP error 504
	at com.atlassian.gadgets.directory.internal.impl.ConfigurableExternalGadgetSpecDirectoryEntryProvider.validateGadgetSpec(ConfigurableExternalGadgetSpecDirectoryEntryProvider.java:139)
	at com.atlassian.gadgets.directory.internal.impl.ConfigurableExternalGadgetSpecDirectoryEntryProvider.access$100(ConfigurableExternalGadgetSpecDirectoryEntryProvider.java:31)
	at com.atlassian.gadgets.directory.internal.impl.ConfigurableExternalGadgetSpecDirectoryEntryProvider$1.doInTransaction(ConfigurableExternalGadgetSpecDirectoryEntryProvider.java:76)
...
Caused by: com.atlassian.gadgets.GadgetParsingException: org.apache.shindig.gadgets.GadgetException: Unable to retrieve gadget xml. HTTP error 504
	at com.atlassian.gadgets.renderer.internal.GadgetSpecFactoryImpl.getGadgetSpec(GadgetSpecFactoryImpl.java:161)
	at com.atlassian.gadgets.renderer.internal.GadgetSpecFactoryImpl.getGadgetSpec(GadgetSpecFactoryImpl.java:78)
...
Caused by: org.apache.shindig.gadgets.GadgetException: Unable to retrieve gadget xml. HTTP error 504
	at org.apache.shindig.gadgets.DefaultGadgetSpecFactory.fetchObjectAndCache(DefaultGadgetSpecFactory.java:127)
...
{noformat}

h4. Steps to reproduce the problem
# Add an application link between JIRA and Confluence.
# Copy over the Confluence: News gadget URL to JIRA gadget directory.
# Get the following error message:
!error.JPG|thumbnail!
# When remove the gadget get the following error message:
!remove.JPG|thumbnail!

h4.Finding:
Tested in JIRA 6.1 and Confluence 5.3

h4. Temporary Workaround:
Please try the following steps and see you able to get any results:
* Go to *Confluence General Configuration > Feature Settings*
* Un-check the *Compress HTTP Responses*
* Refresh both instance web browser and add the confluence gadgets to JIRA again.
fields.summary: Get exception Unable to retrieve gadget xml. HTTP error 504 when adding Confluence gadget to JIRA dashboard

fields.description:
Editing Office documents is not working in current official release of Firefox 29 (stable). This virtually makes the Office Connector unusable for us as Internet Explorer is disabled in our company because of security issues and Chrome does not support the Office Connector.
Aurora releases were available for quite some time by now, so for release date I expect a working connector for Firefox.

h4. Workaround

If you right click and select "Open in New Tab" a new (blank) tab will open and so will the office application with the document you requested. _Note: This will not save the changes back to Confluence automatically._
fields.summary: Office Connector not working in Firefox 29 and Firefox 30

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33467].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Create a page tree macro

*Result:*
The page tree macro shows the following, and never an actual page tree:
!Screen Shot 2014-04-29 at 12.50.30 PM.png!

fields.summary: The Page Tree macro will load indefinitely if created when using any font styles (bold, italics, underline)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33466].
  {panel}

When using SSO, it can be difficult to trigger a sync of the opposite type that you have configured.

There are currently two sync types with remote directories - full and incremental. Occasionally, you may want to trigger a sync of the type that is not configured - if you're using incremental sync, you may wish to trigger a full sync on occasion, and vice versa.

Currently, you must undertake the following steps:

# Shut down Confluence
# Remove the SSO Configuration
# Start Confluence
# Log in as a local admin
# Update the option for the sync setting on the remote directory
# Perform the sync
# Shut down Confluence
# Restore the SSO Configuration
# Start Confluence

Shutting down Confluence creates a window of downtime for non admin users, as they are unable to log in due to the lack of SSO.
fields.summary: When using Single Sign On (SSO), triggering a sync is painful.
